title: Untitled Goose Game: How a mean goose is setting the memes loose
text:
New game proves that it’s fun to be annoying

Ever nagged your brother, sister, parents or friends?

We all have.

And most of the time, we’re told to “cut it out” or Mom threatens to turn the car around and cancel the whole vacation.

Truth is, sometimes it’s just so satisfying to be a nuisance.

And that’s probably why a new indie game, Untitled Goose Game, is the best-selling title on the Nintendo Switch this week.

Nintendo/YouTube

Since its release on Sept. 20, the game has garnered a lot of attention.

The premise of the game is simple. You are a goose whose sole objective is to annoy a group of villagers.

You can honk to scare the wits out of an unsuspecting couple or steal and hide tools from someone trying to garden.

The list of possible shenanigans goes on.

As long as you’re being annoying, you’re playing to win.

And with a game this absurd, it’s only natural that the internet is blowing up with #honk-inspired memes.

One Twitter user suggests that for a villain as big as a goose, the only logical next step after the village is the Marvel Universe.

Bells are just one of many objects you can take in the game, and another user took that idea straight to Taco Bell.

As you’d expect, some are having trouble explaining the absurd game to others.

And some memes are just as absurd as the game itself.

And it’s not just memes. Some desktop users have even been inspired to goosify their keyboards.

sorry but i couldn't resist making a goose keycap as annoying and obnoxious as the goose in the game

#untitledgoosegame pic.twitter.com/GbSkFoJd6i — tiny ~ SPOOKeycap maker �� (@tinymakesthings) October 2, 2019

We’re just glad that so many people finally have an outlet for their inner goose.

Keep on #honking on.
description: New “Untitled Goose Game” is a top seller on Nintendo Switch and spawning all kinds of memes.
